programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Roman and Burgess discover the corpse of a young boy who was reported missing; Burgess talks to Ruzek about Roman's suspicious behavior; Bunny plans to make a statement that could impact Voight's career.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: A desperate man searching for his daughter holds a member of the team hostage; Voight learns about the accusations Bunny made regarding a case from his past; Antonio finds out that Olinsky has been keeping a secret.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Voight believes the man who tried to kill him is someone he and Olinsky once put away; Atwater unintentionally spills information about Ruzek's history that disturbs Burgess.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Ruzek's future with the unit is in question after a botched undercover job; a corpse is discovered in an SUV; Lindsay and Halstead move forward with their relationship.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Ruzek's future with the unit is in question after a botched undercover job; a corpse is discovered in an SUV; Lindsay and Halstead move forward with their relationship.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Intelligence searches for a missing teen who they believe poses a threat to students at his school; Atwater wants to make a good impression on a police captain.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: When Intelligence follows up on a tip about an upcoming drug trade, the team discovers a man's mutilated body; Burgess helps plan a surprise for Platt.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: A decapitated corpse found in Lake Michigan is connected to Voight's social circle; Roman makes a grave error; Antonio makes a decision that could impact Michelle's future -- without consulting Olinsky.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: A doctor connected to Voight is investigated after four patients with chemo overdoses are sent to Chicago Med; Platt and Burgess work to clear Roman's name.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: A teenage girl is violated during a home invasion; Voight helps a former acquaintance; Platt and Mouch receive upsetting news regarding their upcoming wedding.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Voight wants to make his former cellmate a confidential informant as the unit tries to take down a big cocaine supplier and local dealers; Burgess makes a decision about her relationship with Ruzek; Roman works with Firehouse 51 to fund a wedding.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Lindsay goes under cover in hopes of finding a police officer who targets women leaving a local casino; Burgess needs Platt's approval to move forward with her plan; Antonio offers to take Roman's place in an upcoming boxing match.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: Radio host Dr. Silvia runs an on-air love and relationship advice show for women. When Mike Hammer's girlfriend takes Dr. Silvia's advice to dump him, he makes an unscheduled guest appearance in her studio in order to give her a piece of his mind. With his new reputation as a macho bully, Mike Hammer becomes the prime suspect after she is suddenly murdered. Now, he and his team must prove his innocence by finding the real killer.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: Mike Hammer travels down to Texas to attend his friend's wedding, but he still finds a case to work. Complications immediately arise when he discovers that the bride is missing. The fiancé's cousin is found dead with her organs surgically removed, and now the bride-to-be must be located before she might meet the same fate. Mike Hammer is the only one who can stop this white wedding from turning bloody.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: Maya Ricci's boyfriend Tony is something of a mystery man who tends to come and go without much explanation. When he surprises Maya for a visit, his disappearance the following morning is caused by more sinister circumstances. When his car is discovered in the debris of an explosion and a mysterious strangers starts asking about Maya, Hammer and his team take up the investigation. They uncover a connection between Tony and the CIA, and other more nefarious entities. Mike decides to protect Maya at any costs before it is too late.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Sam resumes an alias and flies to Yemen to find the leader of a terrorist group and rescue a Saudi prince's son.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: A Navy Intelligence commander is tracking the moves of a Venezuelan politician, then the officer disappears, leaving the team to wonder if the politician is now in danger.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: When an attempted robbery takes place at a secure facility on a Marine base, Kensi must determine what the thief intended to steal.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: After a rocket engine expert is killed, Eric goes under cover to ensure the classified technology used to build satellites is safe.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: In order to protect his best friend and main informant, Deeks resumes a former alias that he dislikes.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Firehouse 51 responds to an unusual call from another firehouse; the addition of a new firefighter (Miranda Rae Mayo) has repercussions; Casey realizes that certain voters have personal agendas for wanting him elected.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: A propaganda attack causes Casey to reconsider his run for alderman; when a man is trapped inside a burning car, it seems the fire may have been set intentionally; Trudy's nerdy brother plans Mouch's bachelor party; a kidnapping investigation.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Severide is led to reexamine a case from the past while he investigates the discovery of a baby's body in a chimney; with election day nearing, Casey prepares for another confrontation with Alderman.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: A call takes a bad turn when Brett witnesses a murder while aiding a victim who has a leg wound; a restaurant fire has people trapped inside a vault; Mouch gets cold feet about his upcoming wedding.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Casey attempts to use political influence to remedy a gang retribution incident; Severide helps Holloway in a dangerous undercover investigation.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Detective Holloway testifies in court as part of an undercover operation, leaving Severide to watch her young son; a fire at an art gallery with a victim trapped inside leads Cruz to make a rash decision.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Dawson risks her life to save a boy in an apartment fire; Severide pushes for an upgrade on the house's fire masks; Cruz and Brett have an idea to get Otis to take a blood test.

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: A building collapses and leaves dozens of people trapped and injured; Chief Boden faces a life-or-death decision in the rescue plan; Dawson continues her quest to foster Louie; tensions flare between Casey and Antonio.

programme.title: Pokerstars Big Game on Tour
programme.desc: The Big Game is back in Las Vegas for another thrilling season, featuring an amateur player taking on some of the biggest names in poker, including Jennifer Tilly. Also joining the action is legendary soccer star Gerard Piqué.

programme.title: Pokerstars Big Game on Tour
programme.desc: More high stakes cash action from Las Vegas. Bomb pots make their explosive Big Game debut, leaving one player fuming and in need of a reload. Meanwhile, Loose Cannon Jordan Handrich faces off against UK pro Sam Grafton in a hand worth $40,000.

programme.title: Pokerstars Big Game on Tour
programme.desc: It's a high stakes cash game in Vegas with an amateur player competing against the pros. Tonight, Jordan the Loose Cannon goes for bomb pots, while Jennifer Tilly and Sam Grafton spar in multiple hands, with tens of thousands of dollars on the line.

programme.title: Pokerstars Big Game on Tour
programme.desc: Hollywood star Jennifer Tilly continues to crush, as the penultimate session of this high stakes cash game begins. Meanwhile, time is running out for the Loose Cannon to bank a profit, and Gerard Piqué tries to recover some of his five-figure losses.

programme.title: Pokerstars Big Game on Tour
programme.desc: It's all to play for in Las Vegas, as this high stakes cash game concludes. Jennifer Tilly and Sam Grafton battle for supremacy, while Gerard Piqué is determined to finally get the better of the poker pros and dig himself out of a hole.

With a National title, the Tewaaraton Award winner, and record shattering season – she has cemented herself as an all-time great. We also went to Charlottesville, VA to dissect the elite game of Connor Shellenberger: a hometown hero, and arguably the best player in history for the University of Virginia.

programme.title: The Comeback
programme.desc: A couple moves with their daughter back to Atlanta, their hometown. They remember exactly why they left when an old flame and family issues resurface.

programme.title: Love and Leftovers
programme.desc: Jacob is a successful chef with big dreams of opening his own restaurant, but struggles in his personal life due to his demanding girlfriend, Drina. When Lisa, a strong-willed and grounded woman comes along and sees his potential, Jacob finds himself torn between something familiar, or something new.

programme.title: A Wonderful Lie
programme.desc: When a fading romance author goes missing, a team of investigators piece together clues that ultimately lead them to a shocking discovery.

programme.title: A Matter of Heart
programme.desc: Balen, a successful family man, risks everything for a reckless affair. His wife, Krista, faces a harsh reality as her sacrifices are tested. Enter Latricia, a ruthless temptress with no shame. A story that weaves a tale of emotional turmoil, family crisis, unwavering faith, and the destructive power of temptation. Will love or lust prevail?

programme.title: The Laundry Room Stalker
programme.desc: A string of murders targeting local neighborhood sex workers centers around one apartment building's laundry room. Suspicion quickly falls on Calvin, the newly hired attendant who was just released after serving 12 years in prison. But this building holds a thousand secrets, and as tensions rise, the truth will unravel. Who is the real killer?

programme.title: My Killer Ex Girlfriend
programme.desc: After leaving his possessive ex, a man and his new girlfriend become targets of stalking that escalates into mind games, threats, and danger.

programme.title: The Perfect Wife
programme.desc: Following a car crash that claimed her brother’s life, a woman marries the man she blames for the accident only to make his life a living hell.

programme.title: The Perfect Wife 2
programme.desc: Recently widowed and on the rebound, Allan instantly falls for Erica and the two quickly marry, but he soon learns she isn't that all she seems.

programme.title: The Hanged Man
programme.desc: The life story of Ron Van Clief, the first black martial arts movie star, known to many as "The Black Dragon"; his determination to win, despite horrific odds, exacts a heavy toll with spectacular highs and devastating lows.

programme.title: Mama Jones
programme.desc: Following a family tragedy, a grief-stricken matriarch becomes territorial when her son and his girlfriend come home with a surprise.

programme.title: A Lot Like Christmas
programme.desc: After being gone for 7 years, a man returns to New Orleans for Christmas with his loving, dramatic family to reconnect with love and forgiveness.

programme.title: A True Christmas
programme.desc: Reminded of her past, Jessica can't stand Christmas, but this holiday season has several surprises in store that will help her create new memories.

programme.title: The Wrong Man
programme.desc: After a devastating loss, a widowed mother seeks to provide stability for her two children and find new love. But love is not always what it seems.

programme.title: Priceless: The Dawn
programme.desc: Music legends Donica and Shequell's plan to start their own record label puts a target on their backs in unexpected ways.

programme.title: Droppin Bodies
programme.desc: Julia, a mother haunted by a violent past, flees her old life to protect her daughter, Kelsey. But when Kelsey is tragically murdered by her boyfriend, Julia is left shattered and betrayed. Abandoned by a justice system that fails to bring her daughter's killer to account, she's forced to confront the darkness she once escaped.

programme.title: Holiday Heist
programme.desc: College student Raymond's relaxed holiday plans are upended when his divorced parents, Marcus and Hope, arrive early for their annual Christmas tradition. Just as they're about to leave and Raymond's friends are due, a massive snowstorm traps everyone inside. The chaos escalates when they discover Hope's new boyfriend, Greg, is a con artist who's swindled them all. Forced to unite, Marcus and Hope put aside their differences to outwit Greg.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "The Corpse Vanishes" (1942) Horror. A mad botanist drains kidnapped brides to keep his 80-year-old wife looking young. With Bela Lugosi, Luana Walters, Elizabeth Russell.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: Supernatural occurrences lead a former mental patient to believe that someone or something is after her inheritance in "The Screaming Skull.".

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Devil Doll" (1964) Horror. A ventriloquist puts a girl's soul in a dummy; with Bryant Haliday; William Sylvester; Yvonne Romain.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Invasion of the Neptune Men" (1961) Science fiction. An alien superhero saves Earth from space invaders.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: After a scientist acquires a device to control men's minds, a feline hero tries to stop his plot to rule the world in "The Puma Man.".

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Werewolf" (1996) Horror. Members of an isolated desert community become beasts when the moon is full.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Time of the Apes" (1987) Science fiction. Two children and a frozen woman wake up 2,000 years later, when apes and a computer rule the world. With Reiko Tokunaga, Hiroko Saito, Masaaki Kaji.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: In Tormented, jazz pianist Tom Stewart, soon to marry the woman he loves, watches former love Vi Mason fall from a lighthouse and does not save her. Vi’s spirit returns and begins to torment Tom at his every step.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: As Jonah and pals suffer through an endless stop-motion sci-fi mayhem in the California desert, an old acquaintance drops in on Kinga and Max.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Hercules" (1959) Adventure. Greek muscleman (Steve Reeves) begins 12 labors, saves princess (Silva Koscina).

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "King Dinosaur" (1955) Science fiction. Scientists land on a planet, find primitive monsters and nuke them. With Bill Bryant, Wanda Curtis, Douglas Henderson.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: In the theater, Joel and the Bots get the third installment of "Radar Men from the Moon" before the Bela Lugosi film "The Corpse Vanishes".

programme.title: Cinematic Titanic
programme.desc: Rogue rattlesnakes attack two young boys in the Southwestern desert, and things go downhill from there.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: “B” movie seems too generous a term for this one — is there such a thing as a “Z” movie? Rondo Hatton plays a disfigured man, a/k/a “The Creeper,” who hunts down and kills the people responsible for his deformity.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A neighbor hears odd sounds coming from the next apartment. When police arrive, they find a man bruised and dead. When all signs point to foul play, it's up to Dr. G to find proof of murder.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Police discover the dead body of Andrew Hopper clutching a syringe and covered with blood. The body is in Dr. G's hands, as are the clues to solving the case.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: It's up to Dr. G to determine if alcohol was to blame in a man's death or if there was a silent killer lurking in his body.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: As each lead turns cold in a gruesome murder case, Dr. G worries justice may never be served. As the autopsy draws to a end, Dr. G uncovers a shocking clue that may solve this crime.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A train engineer panics when he spots a man lying on the tracks. He blows the whistle, but the train can't stop in time. It's up to Dr. G to piece together how Andy Santana died.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G must figure out if a man died as a result of his infected stab wound or if his history of drug abuse was the culprit.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: An otherwise healthy child had been complaining of stomach pains. Could the medicine his mother had recently given him be to blame? Or could his death be from something more sinister?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A mother of infant twins notices that her son is not breathing. EMTs attempt to revive him, but it's too late. Now, Dr. G must work fast to determine if the other twin's life is in danger.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Both natural disease and sport's injury are likely suspects in Eric Brody's death. But then Dr. G learns that he was treated with antibiotics for a spider bite prior to his death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G has a challenge on her hands: a victim's body spent days decaying before it was found, and decomposition could get in the way of her investigation.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A daughter wants to surprise her dad with breakfast in bed but finds him unresponsive. His family is convinced they know what killed him, but Dr. G must let the evidence speak for itself.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Leo Guzman falls off a ladder while painting a house. At first, his death seems to be an open-and-shut case but, as the autopsy unfolds, Dr. G believes there may be more to this case.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. Farley discusses the bizarre case of a pregnant mother who suddenly dies. As the autopsy unfolds, Dr. Farley uncovers information that could have saved her and her unborn child's life.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A train engineer panics when he spots a man lying on the tracks. He blows the whistle, but the train can't stop in time. It's up to Dr. G to piece together how Andy Santana died.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: When an infant dies under mysterious circumstances, the young parents are prime suspects. Dr. G discovers several clues that bolster the child abuse theory, but the case is not clear cut.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dario Romano is found dead by his son at the bottom of the attic ladder. What happened to this 45-year-old? With Dr. G's guidance, Dr. Stephany must solve the mystery.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: As each lead turns cold in a gruesome murder case, Dr. G worries justice may never be served. As the autopsy draws to a end, Dr. G uncovers a shocking clue that may solve this crime.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G must decide if she can perform a successful autopsy without the deceased's organs. As she ponders the decision, we are given a rare glimpse into a different side of Dr. G's job.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Reed Baley is found unconscious the morning after his bachelor party. Now, it's up to Dr. G to determine if alcohol was to blame or if there was another cause of death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A mother of infant twins notices that her son is not breathing. EMTs attempt to revive him, but it's too late. Now, Dr. G must work fast to determine if the other twin's life is in danger.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: 58-year-old Leroy Williams is rushed to the ER by his wife after becoming disorientated. Doctors work tirelessly, but Leroy slips into a coma and eventually dies.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Paramedics respond to a mother in distress: one of her infant twin girls hasn't woken up. By the time help arrives, it's too late. But there is no apparent cause of death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: In a bizarre scene, 44-year-old Olga Petrova is found severely burnt in her home after a heated argument with her fiancé. Police want to question him and find out what happened, but he's nowhere to be found.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G must figure out if a man died as a result of his infected stab wound or if his history of drug abuse was the culprit.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A woman is killed in a drunk driving accident. At first, her death seems to be an open-and-shut case, but Dr. G discovers clues that the woman may have played a key role in her own death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G has a challenge on her hands: a victim's body spent days decaying before it was found, and decomposition could get in the way of her investigation.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A woman fears the worst when her aunt stops answering her calls. When her greatest fear is confirmed, Dr. G must determine one thing: was this a fatal fall?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Police make a grisly discovery: a woman's battered and dead body. With little evidence and no witnesses, Dr. G must identify the body and determine the cause of death to catch her killer.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G suspects that someone is responsible for a vagrant's unusual death. She'll only discover the truth by finding answers to the strange events surrounding this curious case.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Even with many leads, including an insulin overdose, a tooth infection and chronic lupus, the pieces don't add up in the case of a woman's death. Will Dr. G be able to uncover the truth?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A hotel clerk calls 9-1-1 complaining of severe facial trauma, but he has no recollection of what happened and dies soon after. Police are counting on Dr. G to aid them in this investigation.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.desc: Steve Harvey assumes the hosting duties for this daytime game show in which five members of one family are pitted against five members of another family. programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don grows a plant he's never tried before, loofahs. He also celebrates some of his favourite tulip combinations and plants out crocosmia. Joe Swift visits a garden, created by an award-winning designer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is at Longmeadow, preparing for the seasons to come. He demonstrates a quick and easy way to prune shrub roses and then plants up pots that will flower in time for Christmas. Grasses look their best at the end of summer and Carol Klein visits a garden in Somerset where they have been used to maximum effect on a sloping site with a range of soil conditions.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes some practical steps to protect tender plants as the first frosts of the year begin to bite. He also starts preparing for next spring, planting tulips, pansies and apple trees and sharing his advice on training step-over apples and planting out wallflowers from seed. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is at Glebe Cottage demonstrating how to grow plants from cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes spring at Longmeadow with plenty of changes in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential pruning, he lifts and divides perennials, starts sowing chillies and begins growing this year's vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With Halloween just round the corner, Monty Don is harvesting his pumpkins and showing how to store them for roasts, soups and stews in the coming months. Joe Swift visits a high end garden in West London to get some tips on how clever landscaping and the use of lighting can turn a small space into an outdoor room which can be used all year round.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With Bonfire Night in mind, Monty Don turns his attention to the firecracker colours of spring when he begins to tidy up his herbaceous plants to make room to plant tulip bulbs. As well as recommending varieties for an early display, he also shows what to plant now under the shade of trees for colour next year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don has plenty of advice on the jobs to do now and over the winter in the garden. He also reviews some of the plants which have thrived and those which have not during the extraordinary summer of 2012. On Walney Island in Cumbria, Carol Klein also explores the diversity of wild plants which thrive in its maritime climate and discovers a very special hardy geranium which grows nowhere else in the world.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The first signs of spring herald the start of the new gardening year. Monty Don reveals the changes he has made to his garden over the winter, tackles timely pruning tasks and shows the best way to lay a new path. Meanwhile, snowdrops are lighting up the winter garden and Carol Klein is out and about in Oxfordshire celebrating their staggering diversity.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don revels in his passion for roses as he sets about planting some bare root varieties in the Jewel Garden at Longmeadow in readiness for a colourful spring and summer. Continuing the rose theme, there is an inspirational visit to the magnificent formal rose garden of Hever Castle in Kent, home to a breathtaking collection of hybrid teas.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don demonstrates how to prepare for spring and summer with timely tasks in his damp garden and around the pond, and Joe Swift continues his series of master classes on planting design by sharing tips on how to create a tropical green oasis. Elsewhere, Carol Klein plants a viburnum that will give spring colour and fill her Devon garden with fragrance.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don looks ahead to the long Easter weekend by cutting back his grass borders. Meanwhile, Joe Swift reveals his top tips for creating a natural garden, and Carol Klein travels to Cornwall in search of a garden full of spring colour. Plus, the `living catalogue' of new and existing varieties of bedding plants at Ball Colegrave in Banbury, Oxfordshire.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don shows us how to plant pots of bulbs for fabulous summer colour. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is out and about looking at native celandines, Wordsworth's favourite flower. They grace our hedgerows and woods at this time of year. The wild strains are too invasive for most domestic gardens, but Carol finds a number of cultivated varieties that should suit most of us.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is at RHS Garden Wisley in Surrey to learn from the experts there how easy alpines are to grow, which seeds are needed to plant a wildflower meadow and the best orchids to grow for each room in the house. Meanwhile, Carol Klein helps Britain in Bloom volunteer Michael Welsh, who is determined to bring colour to the former colliery town of Easington with a community garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don searches for signs of spring in his garden at Longmeadow. Taking inspiration from his trip to RHS Garden Wisley, he plants up an alpine trough. Meanwhile, Carol Klein looks at native celandines which grace hedgerows and woods at this time of year.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don plants a vine to grow dessert grapes and looks at varieties that can be grown outside as well as in a greenhouse. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is at home in Glebe Cottage where she reveals a little of the fascinating history of one of our spring favourites, Trillium grandiflorum. Plus, Rachel de Thame explores a suburban, hidden garden with charms all of its own.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don, Joe Swift and Carol Klein go behind the scenes at the Malvern Spring Gardening Show. While Monty takes a sneak peak at the floral marquee before the show opens, Carol hunts for rare and unusual plants.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The programme comes from all four of the Royal Horticultural Society gardens, where the team are out on the road exploring how each location's differing climate affects the plants they grow. Carol Klein broadcasts from Wisley in Surrey. In the garden at Harlow Carr in Yorkshire, Joe Swift gets plenty of propagating tips. Rachel de Thame explores the gardens at Hyde Hall in Essex, and Monty Don visits Rosemoor in Devon.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the winter draws to a close, work in the garden starts to step up gear. With the flowers and fruits of summer in mind, Monty Don gets going by planting pots of summer bulbs for colour and scent, passing on his secrets of success by using a variety of planting techniques. He also reveals plans for reinvigorating the area in his garden where perennials are planted. Plus, Carol Klein visits Glendurgan Garden in Cornwall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty tackles three seasons of gardening when he makes additions to his spring garden, gives advice on how to dry and preserve herbs for winter and plants up a container to give interest from now until spring. Carol celebrates one of the plant successes of an extraordinary summer, the Canna while Frances Tophill tackles a viewer's garden and suggests plants which will perform throughout the winter. Toby Buckland visits a garden in Devon with Japanese influences.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is back at the helm, but this time in the garden at his own Herefordshire home - a place that he has lovingly nurtured for the last 20 years. With winter receding, Monty, Carol Klein, Joe Swift and Rachel de Thame are preparing for spring. As well as showing us round his garden, Monty lifts and divides snowdrops and sows beetroot and plants onions. Monty also prunes his apple trees and trims his shrub roses.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty helps two families create dream gardens that are as much for the children as for the adults. In Doncaster, Nikki and John want a garden full of edible plants and fruit.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty faces some of the most surprising plans yet - a Norwegian garden complete with waterfalls to be fashioned out of a tiny back yard in Dorset, and nothing less than a Japanese tea garden to be created out of a patch of ground in Bromley.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don visits some of the most famous and interesting gardens in France. Here, he tells the stories behind France's important historic gardens. These include elaborate walled gardens designed to please the mistress - and then the wife - of a King, and magnificent displays of flowers and fountains that involved thousands of soldiers moving tracts of land and incited violent jealousy in another monarch.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don turns to the French love of food and finds out how this has influenced their gardens. He travels to some of the most famous `potager' or kitchen gardens, where vegetables and flowers are planted together in elaborate and beautiful displays. He also talks to gardeners about this style of planting which has been copied the world over.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels to some of the most celebrated artists' gardens, including the one created by the impressionist Claude Monet, who planted and painted his garden for half his life. Monty also matches the paintings to the garden of Paul Cezanne, as well as visiting several contemporary artistic gardens to see how the use of plants and trees has evolved into new and varied styles.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty tackles three seasons of gardening when he makes additions to his spring garden, gives advice on how to dry and preserve herbs for winter and plants up a container to give interest from now until spring. Carol celebrates one of the plant successes of an extraordinary summer, the Canna while Frances Tophill tackles a viewer's garden and suggests plants which will perform throughout the winter. Toby Buckland visits a garden in Devon with Japanese influences.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: We find out how Rachel de Thame got on over the past year as she attempted to grow her own cut flowers, and if you're still in a quandary about what to grow in your winter pots this year, Monty Don may well have the answer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With Halloween just round the corner, Monty Don is harvesting his pumpkins and showing how to store them for roasts, soups and stews in the coming months. Joe Swift visits a high end garden in West London to get some tips on how clever landscaping and the use of lighting can turn a small space into an outdoor room which can be used all year round.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes some practical steps to protect tender plants as the first frosts of the year begin to bite. He also starts preparing for next spring, planting tulips, pansies and apple trees and sharing his advice on training step-over apples and planting out wallflowers from seed. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is at Glebe Cottage demonstrating how to grow plants from cuttings.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Come visit the coast with Bob Ross and paint a glorious ocean-scape; enjoy the solitude and gentle rhythm of the waves caressing the shoreline.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: Welcome to The Fly Shop Tour! In September of 2022, we set across the Rocky Mountains on a 2500 Mile Road Trip visiting & fishing with local Fly Shops. Our Mission? To highlight small businesses that drive the sport we love: Fly Fishing! Along the way, we got a chance to host meetups in every state - all with the goal to raise money for local conservation organizations & meet some of our fans. Follow us as we tell the story of 12 unique fly shops, fish the waters surrounding their area, and make our way throughout the Rocky Mountains.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: As the SoCal Bluefin Tuna fishing season begins to take shape, Ali and Rush head out to fish the waters of San Diego and see what new surprises may be in store for them this year. For many boats in the fleet, the heading turns to the south for a visit to the commercial tuna pen operation that often attracts other fish from miles away. It's parking lot fishing at its best, but with a change in technique and break from the crowd Ali puts Rush on the bite!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: When it comes to fishing and the marine industry, we are often more united by the Bluefin tuna than we think. For Ali Hussainy, the Bluefin is responsible for fueling his life long passion as an angler, and in this episode he gets to share that passion with two friends that have their own ties to the species. For wildlife biologist Forrest Galante and master sushi chef Hiroyuki Terada, catching a bluefin tuna on rod and reel will be a first!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Local Knowledge crew heads to Catalina Island off the coast of Southern California to participate in the 2024 War Heroes On Water tournament. This event offers a unique opportunity for the sport fishing community to create meaningful connections with our nation's heroes while raising awareness of the challenges they sometimes face when transitioning back to civilian life. With a little bit of luck and a lot of teamwork, Ali and Rush hope to put their veterans on a Bluefin tuna bite they won't forget!

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: Welcome to The Fly Shop Tour! In September of 2022, we set across the Rocky Mountains on a 2500 Mile Road Trip visiting & fishing with local Fly Shops. Our Mission? To highlight small businesses that drive the sport we love: Fly Fishing! Along the way, we got a chance to host meetups in every state - all with the goal to raise money for local conservation organizations & meet some of our fans. Follow us as we tell the story of 12 unique fly shops, fish the waters surrounding their area, and make our way throughout the Rocky Mountains.

programme.desc: A seemingly good man takes in a divorced mom and her son.

programme.title: Cannonball Run II
programme.desc: The usual suspects return for a new breakneck, ocean-to-ocean free for all!

programme.title: Deal of the Century
programme.desc: An arms dealer attempts to sell war planes to a South American dictator.

programme.title: The Adventures of Pluto Nash
programme.desc: In the year 2087, a bold casino owner, his android bodyguard and a beautiful, aspiring singer are on the run from a millionaire gangster on the moon.

programme.title: Clara's Heart
programme.desc: A housekeeper has inspiring influence on a child with divorcing parents.

programme.title: Critters
programme.desc: Outer-space furballs devour everything in their path in a small town.

programme.title: Oh, God!
programme.desc: When God comes to Earth, he struggles to convince his chosen messenger about who he really is.

programme.title: Oh, God! Book II
programme.desc: God returns to Earth and recruits a student to help him devise an advertising campaign to spread his message.

programme.title: Oh, God! You Devil
programme.desc: A musician sells his soul to the Devil, as God and the Devil battle for the musician's soul.

programme.title: The Mummy Lives
programme.desc: An ancient mummy returns from the dead and becomes obsessed with a woman he believes is his dead lover.

programme.title: Wedding Wars
programme.desc: A gay party planner agrees to organize the nuptials for his straight brother until he finds out that he is behind a speech against gay marriage.

programme.title: Surrender, Dorothy
programme.desc: Hoping to learn more about her daughter Sara after her sudden death, Natalie retreats to the beach house where Sara's friends are summering.

programme.title: Christmas on Division Street
programme.desc: Follows the unlikely friendship between a bullied teenage school boy and the unhomed American history buff he wants to help before Christmas.

programme.title: My Girl
programme.desc: An independent 11-year-old girl spends a summer running around the neighborhood with her shy best friend, who teaches her about life.

programme.title: The Waterdance
programme.desc: Injured in a climbing accident, writer Joel Garcia (Eric Stoltz) wakes up in a hospital having lost the use of his legs. Soon after, he's placed in a recovery ward where he begins the arduous process of rehabilitation and meets others with injuries like his own. Raymond (Wesley Snipes) is a ladies' man whose girl has nevertheless split, and Bloss (William Forsythe) is a rather prejudiced biker. Together, this unlikely trio helps one another to overcome the greatest challenge of their lives.

programme.title: 7 Seconds
programme.desc: Wesley Snipes stars as a skilled art thief who has to come up with a rescue plan when his partner is kidnapped in retaliation for their crimes.

programme.title: Company of Heroes
programme.desc: Set during World War II, Company of Heroes, follows US military units during the Battle of Normandy and the Allied liberation of France.

programme.title: Sunset
programme.desc: Bruce Willis and James Garner star as 1920s legends, actor Tom Mix and crimefighter Wyatt Earp, who join forces to solve a Beverly Hills killing.

programme.title: Rag and Bone
programme.desc: When a New Orleans priest-turned-cop is implicated in a shooting incident, he gets help clearing his name from the ghost of a corrupt officer.

programme.title: Every Time We Say Goodbye
programme.desc: When an American pilot meets a serene Jewish girl of Spanish descent during World War II, their diverse backgrounds might mean love could never work.

programme.title: Ike : Countdown to D-Day
programme.desc: This film is the story of two great military men, their relationship, and the plotting of the global offensive, which turned the tide of World War II.

programme.title: Talhotblond
programme.desc: Thomas meets a beautiful teenager online, with whom he engages in a nearly two-year romance over the Internet until she learns the truth about him, which leads Thomas to exact the ultimate revenge.

programme.title: First Daughter
programme.desc: During a hiking trip, the President's daughter gets kidnapped. Now it is up to Agent McGregor and a river guide to rescue her before it is too late.

programme.title: No Mercy
programme.desc: A Chicago cop looking to avenge the death of his partner heads to New Orleans and kidnaps the killer's mistress by handcuffing himself to her.

programme.title: U-Turn
programme.desc: A criminal looking to pay off his debts meets a couple in Arizona who hope to use him to settle their personal vendettas, even if it involves murder.

programme.title: The Collector
programme.desc: A meek bank clerk and butterfly collector becomes increasingly obsessed with an art student who he’s determined to make fall in love with him.

programme.title: A Night to Remember
programme.desc: In this suspenseful comedy, Nancy Troy (Loretta Young) and her mystery-author husband, Jeff (Brian Aherne), move into a dark basement apartment in New York City's Greenwich Village, in hopes of stirring up writing inspiration. When their neighbors begin acting oddly and one of them turns up dead, Nancy and Jeff must uncover a murder mystery in their own building, with a number of suspects lurking about, including the creepy Mrs. Devoe (Gale Sondergaard).

programme.title: Hot Blood
programme.desc: A gypsy woman who lives by decamping with marriage settlements from wealthy men meets her match in the handsome younger brother of a gypsy king.

programme.title: The Whole Town's Talking
programme.desc: Clerk Arthur Jones (Edward G. Robinson) lives a dull life until someone realizes that he looks like gangster "Killer" Mannion (also Robinson). After Jones is brought in by the police and his identity is verified, he is given a note to assuage any other suspicious policeman. Jones is hired by a newspaper to write about Mannion and starts dating Wilhelmina Clark (Jean Arthur). However, when Jones returns home one night, Mannion is waiting and demands the note so that he can roam freely.

programme.title: We Were Strangers
programme.desc: When her brother is murdered, China Valdez (Jennifer Jones) swears revenge on the corrupt Cuban government he had been protesting. She joins the resistance led by Tony (John Garfield), an American with a plan that promises devastating results to their enemies. First they'll kill a government official, then plant a bomb at the funeral, which will wipe out the dead man's associates when it explodes. All they need to do is to dig an underground tunnel from China's house to the cemetery next door.

programme.title: The Taming of the Shrew
programme.desc: A rich merchant's beautiful daughter and her volatile older sister are courted by rival suitors in this rambunctious version of Shakespeare's comedy.

programme.title: Boston Blackie Goes Hollywood
programme.desc: Rehabilitated ex-convict Boston Blackie (Chester Morris) doesn't crack safes anymore, but single-minded Inspector Farraday (Richard Lane) is determined to link him to the theft of a priceless diamond. When Farraday ropes the diamond's millionaire owner, Arthur Manleder (Lloyd Corrigan), into framing Blackie for the theft, the ex-safecracker and his faithful sidekick, Runt (George E. Stone), have to track down and capture the real thieves while staying one step ahead of the cops.

programme.title: Run Wild, Run Free
programme.desc: A mute boy who spends his days roaming the English countryside starts coming out of his shell when he befriends a wild pony and a retired colonel.

programme.title: Fail Safe
programme.desc: A malfunction inadvertently sends American planes armed with nuclear warheads to Russia in a blunder of potentially apocalyptic proportions.

programme.title: The Notorious Landlady
programme.desc: After falling for his charming landlady, an American diplomat in London learns that she's suspected of murder and tries to help her clear her name.

programme.title: Port Afrique
programme.desc: An American (Phil Carey) returns to Morocco and discovers his wife's past while probing her death.

programme.title: Autumn Leaves
programme.desc: An aging, lonely spinster marries a good-looking younger man only to find that he has a very tormented past and is mentally disturbed.

programme.title: Duffy
programme.desc: A professional smuggler gets involved in a scheme by two half-brothers to steal a fortune from their wealthy father’s yacht in the Mediterranean.

programme.title: Miss Grant Takes Richmond
programme.desc: A bookie operating behind a real estate front gets pulled into the business for real when he hires a daffy secretary who thinks the office is legit.

programme.title: Lust for Gold
programme.desc: During the 1870s, the ruthless Jacob Walz (Glenn Ford) becomes very wealthy after locating a legendary Arizona gold mine and securing sole ownership by murdering his partner. Walz then travels to Phoenix, where he catches the attention of a beautiful and crafty woman named Julia Thomas (Ida Lupino), who has learned of his exploits. Eventually, Walz falls in love with Julia, unaware that she's already married to Pete (Gig Young), who is eyeing his fortune.

programme.title: Reprisal!
programme.desc: Frank Madden (Guy Madison), who is part Native American but passes as white, purchases a ranch in the small town of Kendall, Okla. When Frank moves in, he finds that the bigoted townspeople have recently let three brothers, who are also his neighbors, get away with the lynching murder of innocent Native Americans. As tensions between the townspeople and local Native Americans rise, Hank becomes torn between fighting against injustice and keeping his true identity a secret.

programme.title: The Outlaw Stallion
programme.desc: A boy and his mother are kidnapped by outlaws after the boy's stallion kills the outlaw leader's mount.

programme.title: 40 Guns to Apache Pass
programme.desc: A cavalry captain (Audie Murphy) rescues settlers and catches a corporal (Kenneth Tobey) selling rifles to Apaches.

programme.title: Apache Territory
programme.desc: A drifter crossing the Arizona desert routs a band of marauding Apaches and rescues the young survivor of a massacre.

programme.title: Jack McCall, Desperado
programme.desc: A lone gunslinger, Jack McCall (George Montgomery), bursts into a saloon and shoots dead the legendary Wild Bill Hickok (Douglas Kennedy). Arrested and put on trial, McCall recounts a twisted tale that paints Hickok as anything but heroic, explaining how Hickok and McCall's cousin Bat (James Seay) took over McCall's family's plantation, killed his parents and even framed him for crimes he didn't commit. McCall's cold-blooded killing of Hickok was warranted. Or was it?

programme.title: The Man From Tumbleweeds
programme.desc: Ex-convict gunfighters join a state ranger (Bill Elliott) on patrol for outlaws.

programme.title: Conquest of Cochise
programme.desc: A cavalry major (Robert Stack) sides with Apache chief Cochise (John Hodiak) against Comanches after the Gadsden Purchase.

programme.title: 3:10 to Yuma
programme.desc: Dan Evans (Van Heflin), a drought-plagued Arizona rancher, volunteers to take captured stagecoach robber and murderer Ben Wade (Glenn Ford) from Bisbee to Contention City, where the criminal will be put aboard the 3:10 train to Yuma for his trial. Accompanied only by the town drunk, Alex Potter (Henry Jones), Dan battles Wade's henchman (Richard Jaeckel), the murder victim's revenge-minded brother, and the temptation of the large bribe Wade offers in exchange for his freedom.

programme.title: Montana Territory
programme.desc: A cowgirl vigilante (Wanda Hendrix) proves to a deputy (Lon McCallister) that the sheriff (Preston Foster) is an outlaw.

programme.title: Cowboy
programme.desc: A Chicago hotel clerk smitten with the daughter of a trail boss’s business partner goes on a cattle drive with him to Mexico through the real West.

programme.title: Santa Fe
programme.desc: Three brothers become outlaws after the Civil War, while a fourth sibling goes to work for the railroad.

programme.title: Good Day for a Hanging
programme.desc: When the local sheriff is killed after a bank robbery, ex-lawman Ben Cutler (Fred MacMurray) collars the apparent killer, Eddie Campbell (Robert Vaughn). Because of his background as a local youth who spent time living with the Cutlers, Eddie gets the benefit of the doubt from Ben's daughter and his wife-to-be, Ruth (Margaret Hayes). Ben is firm in his belief that Eddie is guilty, and as the matter is debated in a divisive court battle, it will soon become clear whether or not he's right.

programme.title: Fort Ti
programme.desc: Capt. Horn (George Montgomery) and Rogers' Rangers raid Fort Ticonderoga during the French and Indian War.

programme.title: Edge of Eternity
programme.desc: Widowed Les Martin (Cornel Wilde) is an ex-detective haunted by a case he left behind in Denver. Now, Martin is the deputy sheriff of a small Arizona town with nothing to do but pull over beautiful local socialite Janice Kendon (Victoria Shaw) for occasional speeding -- until a mysterious murder at a nearby ghost town requires him to put his old skills to use once again. With the help of Sheriff Edwards (Edgar Buchanan) and Kendon, Martin must unravel a murderous plot involving stolen gold.

programme.title: Lightning Guns
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) investigates the murder of a banker who was about to loan a rancher some money for a controversial dam project.

programme.title: Ride Lonesome
programme.desc: A bounty hunter escorts a killer to prison but allows his outlaw brother to catch up with them to have a showdown over a previous shocking murder.

programme.title: The White Squaw
programme.desc: A Swedish settler (David Brian) starts a war when he tries to drive Dakotas off their Wyoming reservation.

programme.title: Souls For Sale
programme.desc: In 19th-century Chinatown, adventurer Gilbert De Quincey saves slave girls.

programme.title: San Antonio
programme.desc: A reformed rustler tracks down a band of cattle thieves.

programme.title: Papillon
programme.desc: A biography of a man who is unjustly convicted of murder, gets locked up in French Guiana, and devotes his life to escaping from prison.

programme.title: Weekend at the Waldorf
programme.desc: The lives of guests and staff intertwine at a hotel over one weekend.

programme.title: Marie Antoinette (1938)
programme.desc: Lavish biography of the French queen who "let them eat cake."

programme.title: Pocket Money
programme.desc: A small-town boy's school experiences the joys and pains of growing up.

programme.title: Period of Adjustment
programme.desc: A newlywed couple's honeymoon is disrupted by a friends' marital problems.

programme.title: The Prisoner of Zenda
programme.desc: A man gets mixed up in palace intrigue when a king-to-be is kidnapped.

programme.title: Rocky Mountain
programme.desc: A Confederate troop makes a desperate attempt to build an army in the West.

programme.title: Room for One More
programme.desc: A couple raising three kids brings two orphaned children into their home.

programme.title: Meet Me in St. Louis
programme.desc: Judy Garland's 1944 musical dramatizes turn-of-the-century family life.

programme.title: The Music Man
programme.desc: After convincing Iowa townsfolk to invest in a boys' marching band, a traveling con man's scheme is complicated by his feelings for a local librarian.

programme.title: The Philadelphia Story
programme.desc: On the eve of her wedding, a wealthy woman gets caught in a bind when her ex-husband and a handsome reporter make an appearance in her life.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Tammy must protect a teenage girl after her father is shot in their home; the rest of the team searches for a motive.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: When a man impersonating Lasalle attempts to free a young woman from jail, the team investigates both the impostor and the prisoner; Pride's daughter pays him a surprise visit.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Racial tensions rise in New Orleans when a white officer shoots a black Navy officer he believed was armed in the middle of a busy street party.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: When a Navy sailor is found dead, the team tracks the suspicious movements of people in his life prior to his death; Hannah comes to terms with her daughter's relationship with her ex's new girlfriend.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: When Sebastian is injured while unsuccessfully trying to prevent a kidnapping, NCIS races to find the missing woman and her abductors; the team gets a peek into Agent Carter's personal life.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The team investigates the death of a Naval microbiologist whose hobby as a "myth buster" resulted in his death at the hands of a legendary bayou creature; Agent Khoury conducts an investigation into previous actions of Deputy Director Van Cleef.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: As New Orleans grapples with the effects of COVID-19, Pride sends Tammy and Carter to investigate a suspicious death aboard an offshore humanitarian ship; Wade is overwhelmed by the high volume in the morgue due to COVID-19.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Tammy and Carter continue to investigate a suspicious death aboard a COVID-infected humanitarian ship; Pride and the team discover what may be the key to finding the killer; Wade helps a grieving woman.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Pride and the team take on a group of dirty cops when they discover that a murder victim was also a key witness in multiple excessive force cases; Tammy faces the reality of being in a new relationship.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The team continue to investigate the murder of an officer who was about to blow the whistle on police misconduct; Pride must get creative in order to finally get rid of the dirty cops; the mayor asks Pride to join her new task force.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The team investigates a suspicious death and the missing key piece of evidence is a top secret, high-tech battery; Pride and the team realize there could be deadly consequences if it falls into the wrong hands.

programme.title: Scorpion
programme.desc: When a crisis at LAX prevents dozens of airplanes from landing, the government brings in a group of misfit geniuses to sort things out.

programme.title: Scorpion
programme.desc: The team is called upon by the governor when a virus leaves his daughter with only 24 hours to live; Walter receives a letter about his sister.

programme.title: Scorpion
programme.desc: After failing a military training mission, the team members are determined to prove themselves when an Internet infrastructure is threatened by a bomber.

programme.title: Scorpion
programme.desc: The members of the team disregard Cabe's advice and go to Las Vegas for a casino job; a robbery leads to Walter being arrested.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Male models' good looks may have cost them their lives; Natalia's abusive ex-husband begins stalking her at the lab.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A politician supports the use of eminent domain to clean up a neighborhood, and his dead body is later found in an empty house.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Bizarre incidents take place in the CSI lab after the team begins its investigation into the death of a Santeria practitioner.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A man is decapitated while performing a stunt, and Horatio believes his death was more than just an accident when he learns the hydraulics system had been tampered with.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: While investigating a kidnapping and murder, the team finds a safe with dozens of pictures of missing women; as the team tries to find Boa Vista's kidnapped sister, Horatio must find the killer.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Steve McGarret, a decorated Naval officer, returns to Hawaii to investigate his father's murder and is asked to head up an elite police task force.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Following the abduction of a former NSA cyberterrorism expert, the team must rescue the man and prevent a breach of national security.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: An escalating gang war spills into the stands of a high-school football game, killing several people; an unlikely partnership arises.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: A violent convict escapes from prison and kidnaps a young couple on vacation; McGarrett's estranged sister comes to town.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The team investigates a murder on a cargo ship where pirates impersonated the Coast Guard to board the boat; Adam finally gets the evidence he needs to take down the island's Yakuza operation once and for all.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: When the CEO of a successful surf company is murdered, Kono revisits her past; Five-0 is thrown into the varied but interconnected worlds of North Shore surfing.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: A Navy SEAL accused of murder takes hostages and safe haven on a memorial battleship.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: When Danny's ex-partner is found dead at a Hawaiian luau the Five-0 team's investigation leads them to some dirty cops and a powerful cocaine cartel.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The residents of Midsomer Magna are thrilled when a production crew arrives at the local manor house to film a version of The Scarlet Pimpernel. But the crew members aren't the only visitors to the area - Jones has spotted notorious criminal George Ince nearby. But when the director, Nick Cheney, is found dead - his head severed by a prop guillotine - Barnaby must discover who would have wanted the victim dead. It soon becomes clear that things are not so simple, and the detectives soon have to shift through varying motives, layered by lies, hidden truths, and a possible robbery to be committed.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby is in Midsomer Holm, bidding farewell to reformed criminal Ronnie Tyler, who has taken part in a rehabilitation scheme in the village. Also present is disgraced ex-policeman Jack Colby, a former colleague of Barnaby's – but Jack refuses to talk to his old friend. When Jack is murdered, the detective must delve into the dark secrets in the victim's past. There are certainly dark secrets to uncover, and Barnaby has to determine whether the victim's part in a scandal years earlier at Causton police station, is key to the mystery behind his death. It isn't long before he finds that Eddie Marston is attempting blackmail, and soon murdered as a result, and that Lord Holm is in love with Jack's wife, psychotherapist Gina.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: As the Barnabys prepare for Cully's wedding, Lord Fitzroy and Beth Porteous are married in the pretty village of Bledlow. At the lavish reception at Bledlow Hall that follows, however, tragedy strikes - maid of honour Marina Fellowes is found murdered in one of the rooms by some of the guests. With their honeymoon cancelled, the Fitzroys must contend with a police presence in their home, as Barnaby and Jones try to learn more about the family history. It soon becomes clear there are secrets, deception, and an illegtimate son involved in the mystery, which is further complicated when the estate manager is killed by an arrow.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: It's a good day for the Hicks family, as the name of Tommy Hicks - who was executed during World War I for "cowardice and desertion" - is added to the list on Midsomer Parva's war memorial. Tommy's son Lionel and grandson Dave, mayor of Causton and whom Barnaby does not like (owing to dodgy building work by the mayor's company), are thrilled, but the snooty Hammonds are decidedly less pleased. Henry, the patriarch of the Hammond family, is particularly riled by his insalubrious neighbours, and has nurtured a long-running feud with the Hickses. But the evening after a battle re-enactment in the village, Henry is murdered - and Barnaby must delve into the history of the two families to find the killer, discovering a web of fraud, lies, and hidden truths.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones are in Dunstan to investigate the deaths of a reclusive couple. As they try to establish whether Ron and Libby Wilson were murdered or died of natural causes, their attention is drawn to a dispute raging between a local builder and road protesters nearby. When another death occurs, the detectives learn that there are plenty of dark secrets and fierce hostilities in this apparently idyllic village. Will Jack Purdy's quick temper lead to violence? How far would the protesters go to prevent the bypass being built? And do current events somehow relate to the death of Michael Wilson many years earlier?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When the body of Londoner Charlie Finleyson is discovered in woodland near Midsomer Sonning, Barnaby and Jones find themselves investigating employees at local Midsomer Life magazine. It turns out the dead man was married to the ex-wife of Guy Sandys, the wealthy owner of the publication. As the detectives become aware of a feud between Guy and the proprietor of the Morecroft Hotel, tensions are also heating up between the locals and visiting Londoners. Soon Barnaby and Jones find themselves to trying to piece together the truth about the murder, and learn that someone might be trying to conceal something in their past.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a pub landlady is crushed to death during a magic show in Midsomer Oaks, Barnaby and Nelson uncover conflict between the village church and ancient pagan traditions. Is famous magician Gideon Latimer to blame or is he the target?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones are forced to take part in a team building exercise and Tom has plenty of problems dealing with the young, new, acting Chief Superintendent, John Cotton (Nick Fletcher). Following an explosion in a truck that had been stored in a truck depot, a body is soon discovered in a nearby lake, which turns out to be Alec Grainger, who had been seen arguing with James Parkes (Joseph Millson), the son of Colonel Matt Parkes (Tim Pigott-Smith). James appears to be involved in shady business deals and is blamed by his grandmother Caroline Halsey (Judy Parfitt) - and others - for the suicide of a woman he got pregnant two years before. Barnaby and Jones find themselves delving into a mixture of fraud, smuggling, and lies, trying to piece together the truth.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When two couples vanish into thin air in the village of Monks Barton, Barnaby and Jones hear rumours of haunted woods and witchcraft. Barnaby remains sceptical of this, even when an unidentified body is found in a shallow grave and the missing start turning up dead. He soon has to determine if ghosts, criminals, or something else, is behind the abductions and murders.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: No one could suspect that a prestigious golf club would be the setting for murder, but when one of the major members is found dead, bludgeoned to death in a thicket next to the 13th hole, Barnaby and Jones try to determine what made him leave the fairway. It seems the club has a rift between the snobbish members, and local villagers, the latter only allowed onto the course for a few hours a week. Before long, another member turns up dead, and the detectives soon find the club has a hidden history, involving gambling, illegal money lending and assault, prompting the pair to determine if a club member, or one of its staff, is responsible for the deeds.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A newly discovered masterpiece by landscape artist Henry Hogson causes a stir when it is auctioned for £400,000 - just hours before its former owner is tortured and killed. When another Hogson is stolen, Barnaby decides to become an expert on the Midsomer painter, with the help of art teacher Matilda Simms (Susannah Harker). He soon realises the paintings are not what they seem - but the death toll is rising.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Former secret agent Geoffrey Larkin arrives in Midsomer Parva and stays at Allenby House, a country mansion run by former spies Sir Malcolm Frazer (Benjamin Whitrow), his son Nicky (Peter Davison) and Nicky's wife Jenny (Alice Krige) as a safe house. Geoffrey is soon gashed to death after a cricket match in Midsomer Parva, and the locals blame the 'beast of Midsomer'. However, Barnaby - a former spy himself - soon realises that the killing has links to Allenby House and Cold War Berlin, but is initially thrown off the case by MI6. But when a further murder occurs MI6 Agent Glen Jarvis (Neil Stuke) asks Barnaby back on the case.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Midsomer University science fellow and cycling enthusiast George Jeffers (David Haig) threatens to make public a problem with his state-of-the-art invention Kernel Logic, but American software boss Clinton Finn fears he will lose millions if the truth comes out. When a schoolteacher is killed in a hit-and-run, Barnaby suspects Jeffers was the intended target. The subsequent murder of a fellow cyclist (Philip Jackson) brings the involvement of fellow University associates (Jonathan Cecil and Jim Norton) into sharper focus.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In the peaceful village of Little Worthy, Bob Moss was about to open up his beloved model village, when he found a gruesome extra attraction. Young local, Richard Tanner, had been stabbed in the side and his corpse tied down like Gulliver in Lilliput. Barnaby and Jones wonder who wanted him dead, but when the woman he was secretly meeting is killed during the village's Crazy Craft race, the pair have to delve in and discover who might be lying and hiding secrets.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A cat burglar is on the loose, one known as "the Creeper", but the wave of burglaries he or she have committed, seem to have finally led to murder, when David Roper (Rik Mayall) is found smothered in his bed on the Chettham family estate. Yet Barnaby and Jones learn he may have been planning to write a book that could have been quite uncomfortable for someone, leading the pair to determine whether members of the Chettham family, or their friends, were responsible.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A sleep-walking school teacher (Nancy Carroll) starts to believe she has slit the throats of her mentor (Tim Wylton) and a local handyman man in her sleep, but her friends (Paola Dionisotti and Monica Dolan) are not convinced that she is the culprit, nor is Barnaby. A local philanthropist (Paul Chapman) and his social-climbing wife (Suzanne Burden) are planning the annual Frobisher night - but will it go without a hitch, and can they identify the killer?

programme.title: Miss Marple
programme.desc: A recently deceased friend leaves Miss Marple instructions to investigate a crime.

programme.title: Miss Marple
programme.desc: Miss Marple is slowly piecing together the clues to this highly complex case.

programme.title: Luther
programme.desc: DCI John Luther returns to work following the traumatic arrest of a serial killer.

programme.title: Luther
programme.desc: Luther must out maneuver a trained sniper on a mission to kill police officers.

programme.title: Luther
programme.desc: Luther investigates the abduction of a young mother.

programme.title: Luther
programme.desc: Luther must put his personal life aside and delve inside the mind of a serial killer.

programme.title: Luther
programme.desc: When an art dealer's wife is taken hostage, Luther leads a tense investigation.

programme.title: Luther
programme.desc: Framed for murder, the only person DCI John Luther can turn to for help is Alice.

programme.title: Wallander
programme.desc: Wallander investigates the brutal slaying of an elderly couple at an isolated farmhouse.

programme.desc: Christopher John Cornell was an American musician, singer and songwriter; he was best known as the lead vocalist for the rock bands Soundgarden and Audioslave; Cornell struggled with depression for much of his life.

programme.title: Autopsy: The Last Hours of...
programme.desc: Known as the founder of the Van Halen, a band synonymous with California cool, Eddie Van Halen sold multiple platinum albums and cemented himself in rock 'n' roll history; behind his contagious smile, there was a darker undercurrent.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Some of the most unique and sought-after vehicles make their way across the Barrett-Jackson auction block including a special Hendricks edition Camaro whose massive sale supports a great cause.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: An all-out bidding war begins when a 2003 Hummer H1 Predator Custom SUV crosses the block and catches everyone's attention.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Scottsdale transforms into a car lover's heaven as Barrett-Jackson rolls in town to celebrate 50 years; the best of the best make their way down the auction block.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: From classic 60's muscle cars to modern day Corvettes, from a brand 'new' '90 Toyota Supra with only 191 miles on the clock to '58 Impala convertible and a 2012 McClaren, Las Vegas offers something for every bidder.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: One-of-a-kind American cars have made their way to Houston with cars like the 1968 Chevrolet Corvette Copo and the 1959 Chevrolet 100 hitting the auction block.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: The World's Greatest Collector Car Auctions offers something for everyone, from Mustangs to Camaros, Bentleys to Maseratis, beasts like the Hummer H1 and off-roaders like the Land Cruiser.

programme.desc: A cavalcade of American muscle cars, including Pontiac GTs, Corvettes, Hemi Challengers, Baracudas, Oldsmobiles, Chevelles, crosses the auction block.

programme.desc: Scottsdale auction moments.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby and DaVi are reunited for a mission to help the people of New Orleans; the Big Gun crew scrambles to finish up the Grindstone site; Gord gets greedy and loses a load of logs; Craig loses his cool.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby gives DaVi a very unusual gift; Gabe Rygaard rushes his crew to finish a site; Joe and Coatsy get a job in Alaska; Brad decides to take a risk and dives into a river cave.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Brad and Swilley lose a fight with massive log; while gar fishing with his cousin the Swamp Man finds what could be the log raft.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Gabe brings in someone very unexpected to fill out his shorthanded crew; S&S' bad luck streak continues when they wreck their boat and get into a fight with the Dreadknots; Joe and Coatsy come up with a new plan to start their own company.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby goes on a treasure-hunting mission and ends up in a race against Belinda; Jesse's lesson on the whistles almost takes Luke out; S&S continues to struggle; the Dreadknots' lucky charm gets destroyed.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby finds a legendary old grave site and the crew has an accident; Levi decides to make some major crew changes; Brad and Swilley are the victims of a prank and they lose yet another assistant; Joe and Coatsy have a tough time keeping steady work.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby tries out a new assistant and meets his match; Brad has an MMA title fight; the entire Big Gun crew heads out to cut the next road in high winds; Craig drops a bomb.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Four companies of loggers risk their lives to chop down timber while dealing with mechanical failures, brutal weather and rugged terrain in the Pacific Northwest.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: J.M. Browning strives to meet a big deadline; Stump Branch Logging tempts fate by jury-rigging old equipment; Gustafson races the weather to build an access road; Pihl Logging hauls in the forest's cash crop.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The loggers race to stay one step ahead of a storm approaching the Oregon coast; Jesse pushes his crew to meet their deadline; muddy roads trap Stump Branch trucks; Robby battles for control; lumber market slump.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Some crews shut down while others struggle to stay afloat after stormy weather arrives with a vengeance; the stalled housing market hits home for the loggers.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The news of upcoming layoffs worries the men; Gustafson Logging tries to get back on track; Browning races to meet a big deadline; Pihl Logging is under pressure to finish its Pig Farm job.

programme.desc: Two of Oregon's logging giants, J.M. Browning and Gustafson Logging, fight to survive; Jay Browning must make tough decisions; smaller outfits find winning strategies.
